UserFinancialAuthority.name: UserFinancialAuthority
UserFinancialAuthority.description: Represents the maximum monetary amount a user can authorize for a given financial type and product.

Description.description: The configuration details for the user financial authority record. This field can't be edited.

EndDate.description: The end date when the user financial authority is in effect.

EvaluationMethod.description: The logic that validates the user financial authority. For example, the Claim Coverage Valuation method validates that a payment on a claim coverage doesn’t exceed the maximum amount allowed for the user on that claim coverage product.

FinancialType.description: The financial type associated with the user financial authority.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

MaximumApprovalAmount.description: The maximum monetary amount a user can approve for a financial activity.

Name.description: The name of the financial user authority.

OwnerId.description: The owner associated with the user financial authority.

ProductId.description: The product associated with the user financial authority.

StartDate.description: The start date when the user financial authority is in effect.

UserId.description: The user associated with the user financial authority.
